lines.text: Ever done any posing before?
I'm always posing.
How do you spend your nights?
Re-posing.
Hey, what kind of a sap is that guy?
He's one of those fellas that even his best friends don't tell him.
When a dress costs over a hundred bucks, it's a frock!
I feel like getting into trouble!
when in Greece, open a restaurant.
I read somewhere in a book that you can't have your cake and eat it too.
Aw, baloney! Sure you can have your cake and eat it.
Yeah? How?
Have two cakes!

[to Kay]
Well, if you trip over anything, it's me.

[ordering at a restaurant]
Oh, uh, and a cup of coffee.
Large or small?
Do I look like a small cup of coffee?

It's like a man I knew once. He was suspicious. Bitter, hard, cruel. All those things were written in his face, like a map of his life. He died. I saw him laid out. His face was a new face. It was fine, noble. There was peace in it. He was himself again. Do you see what I mean?
No. All I get out of it is, you got to die to find yourself. Not me. Not for two dollars an hour.
I'm over 18 years old, you know.
Well, most men never get to be 18. And most women are over 18 when they're born.
